target.mrk: Handle to parent or owner window

trans-unit.source: $TCS_BOTTOM - Tabs appear at the bottom of the control

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_BOTTOM - Tabs appear at the bottom of the control

target.mrk: $TCS_BOTTOM - Tabs appear at the bottom of the control

trans-unit.source: $TCS_BUTTONS - Tabs appear as buttons, and no border is drawn around the display area

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_BUTTONS - Tabs appear as buttons, and no border is drawn around the display area

target.mrk: $TCS_BUTTONS - Tabs appear as buttons, and no border is drawn around the display area

trans-unit.source: $TCS_FIXEDWIDTH - All tabs are the same width

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_FIXEDWIDTH - All tabs are the same width

target.mrk: $TCS_FIXEDWIDTH - All tabs are the same width

trans-unit.source: $TCS_FLATBUTTONS - Selected tabs appear as being indented into the background while other tabs appear as being on the same plane as the background.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_FLATBUTTONS - Selected tabs appear as being indented into the background while other tabs appear as being on the same plane as the background.

target.mrk: $TCS_FLATBUTTONS - Selected tabs appear as being indented into the background while other tabs appear as being on the same plane as the background.

trans-unit.source: This only affects tab controls with the $TCS_BUTTONS style.

seg-source.mrk: This only affects tab controls with the $TCS_BUTTONS style.

target.mrk: This only affects tab controls with the $TCS_BUTTONS style.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_FOCUSNEVER - The control does not receive the input focus when clicked

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_FOCUSNEVER - The control does not receive the input focus when clicked

target.mrk: $TCS_FOCUSNEVER - The control does not receive the input focus when clicked

trans-unit.source: $TCS_FOCUSONBUTTONDOWN - The control receives the input focus when clicked

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_FOCUSONBUTTONDOWN - The control receives the input focus when clicked

target.mrk: $TCS_FOCUSONBUTTONDOWN - The control receives the input focus when clicked

trans-unit.source: $TCS_FORCEICONLEFT - Icons are aligned with the left edge of each fixed width tab.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_FORCEICONLEFT - Icons are aligned with the left edge of each fixed width tab.

target.mrk: $TCS_FORCEICONLEFT - Icons are aligned with the left edge of each fixed width tab.

trans-unit.source: This style can only be used with the $TCS_FIXEDWIDTH style.

seg-source.mrk: This style can only be used with the $TCS_FIXEDWIDTH style.

target.mrk: This style can only be used with the $TCS_FIXEDWIDTH style.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_FORCELABELLEFT - Labels are aligned on the left edge of each fixed width tab.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_FORCELABELLEFT - Labels are aligned on the left edge of each fixed width tab.

target.mrk: $TCS_FORCELABELLEFT - Labels are aligned on the left edge of each fixed width tab.

trans-unit.source: The label is displayed immediately to the right of the icon instead of being centered.

seg-source.mrk: The label is displayed immediately to the right of the icon instead of being centered.

target.mrk: The label is displayed immediately to the right of the icon instead of being centered.

trans-unit.source: This style can only be used with the

seg-source.mrk: This style can only be used with the

target.mrk: This style can only be used with the

trans-unit.source: $TCS_FIXEDWIDTH style and it implies the $TCS_FORCEICONLEFT style.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_FIXEDWIDTH style and it implies the $TCS_FORCEICONLEFT style.

target.mrk: $TCS_FIXEDWIDTH style and it implies the $TCS_FORCEICONLEFT style.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_HOTTRACK - Items under the pointer are automatically highlighted.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_HOTTRACK - Items under the pointer are automatically highlighted.

target.mrk: $TCS_HOTTRACK - Items under the pointer are automatically highlighted.

trans-unit.source: You can check whether or not hot tracking is enabled by calling SystemParametersInfo.

seg-source.mrk: You can check whether or not hot tracking is enabled by calling SystemParametersInfo.

target.mrk: You can check whether or not hot tracking is enabled by calling SystemParametersInfo.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_MULTILINE - Multiple rows of tabs are displayed, if necessary, so all tabs are visible at once

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_MULTILINE - Multiple rows of tabs are displayed, if necessary, so all tabs are visible at once

target.mrk: $TCS_MULTILINE - Multiple rows of tabs are displayed, if necessary, so all tabs are visible at once

trans-unit.source: $TCS_MULTISELECT - Multiple tabs can be selected by holding down the CTRL key when clicking.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_MULTISELECT - Multiple tabs can be selected by holding down the CTRL key when clicking.

target.mrk: $TCS_MULTISELECT - Multiple tabs can be selected by holding down the CTRL key when clicking.

trans-unit.source: This style must be used with the $TCS_BUTTONS style.

seg-source.mrk: This style must be used with the $TCS_BUTTONS style.

target.mrk: This style must be used with the $TCS_BUTTONS style.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_OWNERDRAWFIXED - The parent window is responsible for drawing tabs

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_OWNERDRAWFIXED - The parent window is responsible for drawing tabs

target.mrk: $TCS_OWNERDRAWFIXED - The parent window is responsible for drawing tabs

trans-unit.source: $TCS_RAGGEDRIGHT - Rows of tabs will not be stretched to fill the entire width of the control.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_RAGGEDRIGHT - Rows of tabs will not be stretched to fill the entire width of the control.

target.mrk: $TCS_RAGGEDRIGHT - Rows of tabs will not be stretched to fill the entire width of the control.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_RIGHT - Tabs appear vertically on the right side of controls that use the $TCS_VERTICAL style.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_RIGHT - Tabs appear vertically on the right side of controls that use the $TCS_VERTICAL style.

target.mrk: $TCS_RIGHT - Tabs appear vertically on the right side of controls that use the $TCS_VERTICAL style.

trans-unit.source: This value equals $TCS_BOTTOM. This style is not supported if you use visual styles.

seg-source.mrk: This style is not supported if you use visual styles.

target.mrk: This style is not supported if you use visual styles.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_RIGHTJUSTIFY - The width of each tab is increased, if necessary, so that each row of tabs fills the entire width of the tab control.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_RIGHTJUSTIFY - The width of each tab is increased, if necessary, so that each row of tabs fills the entire width of the tab control.

target.mrk: $TCS_RIGHTJUSTIFY - The width of each tab is increased, if necessary, so that each row of tabs fills the entire width of the tab control.

trans-unit.source: This style is ignored unless the $TCS_MULTILINE style is also specified.

seg-source.mrk: This style is ignored unless the $TCS_MULTILINE style is also specified.

target.mrk: This style is ignored unless the $TCS_MULTILINE style is also specified.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_SCROLLOPPOSITE - Unneeded tabs scroll to the opposite side of the control when a tab is selected

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_SCROLLOPPOSITE - Unneeded tabs scroll to the opposite side of the control when a tab is selected

target.mrk: $TCS_SCROLLOPPOSITE - Unneeded tabs scroll to the opposite side of the control when a tab is selected

trans-unit.source: $TCS_SINGLELINE - Only one row of tabs is displayed. The user can scroll to see more tabs, if necessary.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_SINGLELINE - Only one row of tabs is displayed.
The user can scroll to see more tabs, if necessary.

target.mrk: $TCS_SINGLELINE - Only one row of tabs is displayed.
The user can scroll to see more tabs, if necessary.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_TABS - Tabs appear as tabs, and a border is drawn around the display area.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_TABS - Tabs appear as tabs, and a border is drawn around the display area.

target.mrk: $TCS_TABS - Tabs appear as tabs, and a border is drawn around the display area.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_TOOLTIPS - The tab control has a ToolTip control associated with it

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_TOOLTIPS - The tab control has a ToolTip control associated with it

target.mrk: $TCS_TOOLTIPS - The tab control has a ToolTip control associated with it

trans-unit.source: $TCS_VERTICAL - Tabs appear at the left side of the control with tab text displayed vertically.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_VERTICAL - Tabs appear at the left side of the control with tab text displayed vertically.

target.mrk: $TCS_VERTICAL - Tabs appear at the left side of the control with tab text displayed vertically.

trans-unit.source: This style is valid only when used with the $TCS_MULTILINE style.

seg-source.mrk: This style is valid only when used with the $TCS_MULTILINE style.

target.mrk: This style is valid only when used with the $TCS_MULTILINE style.

trans-unit.source: To make tabs appear on the right side of the control, also use the $TCS_RIGHT style.

seg-source.mrk: To make tabs appear on the right side of the control, also use the $TCS_RIGHT style.

target.mrk: To make tabs appear on the right side of the control, also use the $TCS_RIGHT style.

trans-unit.source: $TCS_EX_FLATSEPARATORS - The control will draw separators between the tab items

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_EX_FLATSEPARATORS - The control will draw separators between the tab items

target.mrk: $TCS_EX_FLATSEPARATORS - The control will draw separators between the tab items

trans-unit.source: $TCS_EX_REGISTERDROP - The control generates $TCN_GETOBJECT notification messages to request a drop target object when an object is dragged over the tab items.

seg-source.mrk: $TCS_EX_REGISTERDROP - The control generates $TCN_GETOBJECT notification messages to request a drop target object when an object is dragged over the tab items.

target.mrk: $TCS_EX_REGISTERDROP - The control generates $TCN_GETOBJECT notification messages to request a drop target object when an object is dragged over the tab items.
